trial_identification.studytitle: Exercise in Critically Ill Patients With Sepsis
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Early Intervention With Exercise in Critically Ill Patients With Sepsis: a Randomized Controlled Trial

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Studies of infection and infectious agents
Other inflammatory or immune system disorders

interventions.interventions:
Other interventions - Exercise Other interventions - Usual practice
Placebo Comparator: Control (usual practice) -
Experimental: Exercise -
Other interventions: Exercise The subjects will be given 2 x 30 minute sessions of exercise per day consisting of either passive, active, active assisted depending on level of sedation and stability of condition. According to level of sedation and stability they may also perform sitting exercises
Other interventions: Usual practice These patients will not receive exercise early in their intensive care admission

primaryOutcome.outcome: Fat free mass ie muscle mass (lean tissue) - Fat free mass will be measured by Multi-Frequency Bioelectrical Impedance Spectroscopy (BIS) (ImpediMed SFB7, ImpediMed Ltd, Brisbane, Australia).
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Change from baseline to one week, then change from baseline to two weeks

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Interleukin 6 - 5mls blood from arterial catheter, centrifuged at 1,500 for 10 minutes at 4 degrees C. The supernaturant will be collected and stored at -80 degrees C. The marker will be analyzed by an enzyme-linked immuno-assay.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Change from baseline to measurements taken daily for 7 days

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Tumour necrosis factor alpha (TNF-alpha) - 5mls blood from arterial catheter, centrifuged at 1,500 for 10 minutes at 4 degrees C. The supernaturant will be collected and stored at -80 degrees C. The marker will be analyzed by an enzyme-linked immuno-assay.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Change from baseline to measurements taken daily for 7 days

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Interleukin 10 - 5mls blood from arterial catheter, centrifuged at 1,500 for 10 minutes at 4 degrees C. The supernaturant will be collected and stored at -80 degrees C. The marker will be analyzed by an enzyme-linked immuno-assay.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Change from baseline to measurements taken daily for 7 days

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Vital signs - observation only - Recording of vital signs ie heart rate, ECG, blood pressure, oxygen saturation from the IntelliVue bedside monitor MP70 (Phillips)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Fifteen minutes pre and post every exercise session recorded every 10 seconds

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
- Systemic inflammatory response syndrome with a proven or suspected infectious etiology.
- 18 years and over
- Relatives willing to give consent
- Admitted to intensive care and likely to remain ventilated for > 48 hours
eligibility.exclusivecriteria:
- Patients with septic shock unresponsive to maximal treatment or who are moribund or have an expected mortality within 48 hours
- Head injuries
- Burn injury
- Multiple lower limb fractures

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This study will investigate whether early exercise in critically ill patients will decrease inflammatory markers, increase pro-inflammatory markers and prevent loss of muscle mass.
